meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of intelligence or intellectual activity.
meanings.sent1: The professor's lectures were always so intelligential, making complex topics easy to understand.
meanings.sent2: She had an intelligential approach to problem-solving, always analyzing situations carefully.
meanings.sent3: The detective's intelligential deductions led to solving the mystery in record time.
meanings.sent4: Her intelligential mind was like a well-oiled machine, processing information effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The intelligential nature of the research findings revolutionized the field of science.

meanings.definition: A person possessing intelligence or intellectual abilities.
meanings.sent1: The young prodigy was known as an intelligential in the academic community.
meanings.sent2: As an intelligential, he was sought after for his insightful perspectives on various issues.
meanings.sent3: The group of friends jokingly referred to themselves as the 'intelligential squad'.
meanings.sent4: In the world of chess, he was considered an intelligential, always several moves ahead.
meanings.sent5: Her reputation as an intelligential preceded her, earning respect from all who knew her.
